subs.text: June 2022
subs.name: june2022

subs.text: June 29

This week, we've shipped updates to the #NeoBlockchainToolkit. This brings the toolkit up to date with @Neo_Blockchain v3.3.1 which is running on MainNet today.

There are a few new features that I want to point out:
subs.rawText:
This week, we've shipped updates to the #NeoBlockchainToolkit. This brings the toolkit up to date with @Neo_Blockchain v3.3.1 which is running on MainNet today.

There are a few new features that I want to point out:

subs.text:
NeoExpress adds a couple new commands: `show notification` and `contract download`.

show notification is pretty straightforward - show notifications records for a given time frame or contract. Basically, fills a gap for command line tracker operations in NeoExpress
subs.rawText:
NeoExpress adds a couple new commands: `show notification` and `contract download`.

show notification is pretty straightforward - show notifications records for a given time frame or contract. Basically, fills a gap for command line tracker operations in NeoExpress

subs.text:
Contract Download is much more involved - it downloads a contract + its associated storage records from a public network (i.e. MainNet) and adds them to your local Express chain.

Major thanks to ixje from @coz_official for the contribution!
subs.rawText:
Contract Download is much more involved - it downloads a contract + its associated storage records from a public network (i.e. MainNet) and adds them to your local Express chain.

Major thanks to ixje from @coz_official for the contribution!

subs.text: This release also sees a significant update to Neo.BuildTools. We've added new tasks to automatically run the Neo C# compiler and NeoExpress batch files during the build process. Dramatically simplifies the project files for C# contract developers: [link]
subs.rawText:
This release also sees a significant update to Neo.BuildTools. We've added new tasks to automatically run the Neo C# compiler and NeoExpress batch files during the build process. 

Dramatically simplifies the project files for C# contract developers: https://t.co/uaWQrcrjo7

subs.text: No new major features in the Neo Contract debugger for this release. Storage Schema (announced in this thread: [link]) is still in preview. v3.3 compatible versions of both production and preview debuggers are available from the @code marketplace
subs.rawText: No new major features in the Neo Contract debugger for this release. Storage Schema (announced in this thread: https://t.co/SnqmZ0i6fo) is still in preview. v3.3 compatible versions of both production and preview debuggers are available from the @code marketplace

subs.text: The NGD Enterprise sample contracts Registrar ([link]) and NFT (https://t.co/ZnRiYKB8a0) have been updated to the latest Neo + Toolkit bits - including the updated build tools - so you can easily experiment with how these tools work.
subs.rawText: The NGD Enterprise sample contracts Registrar (https://t.co/Xeyt3IrpnO) and NFT (https://t.co/ZnRiYKB8a0) have been updated to the latest Neo + Toolkit bits - including the updated build tools - so you can easily experiment with how these tools work.

subs.text: Neo Visual DevTracker's C# contract template has also been updated with the new build tools, so creating a new contract will be correctly configured from the get-go.
subs.rawText: Neo Visual DevTracker's C# contract template has also been updated with the new build tools, so creating a new contract will be correctly configured from the get-go.

subs.text: As usual, I'm around to answer questions about @Neo_Blockchain development both here on Twitter and on the Neo Discord ([link])
subs.rawText: As usual, I'm around to answer questions about @Neo_Blockchain development both here on Twitter and on the Neo Discord (https://t.co/SYrmRzIa17)

subs.text: I suspect Jon Cooper was on the edge of tears because the bolts gave up a third period lead in their own barn to put the 'lanch ahead in the series 3-1. Whining about a marginal call like an over invested little league dad who played ball in college is not a good look Jon. [link]
